description_txt: stated on May 2, 2010 in an interview on ABC News' 'This Week':
quote_txt: A letter from BP to the Minerals Management Service "actually recommends improvements and specific recommendations around safety regulations should they choose to change them."

description_txt: stated on May 2, 2010 in an interview on ABC News' 'This Week':
quote_txt: "Brazil got off oil in the last 30 years."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says Texas has been waiting for two years for the federal government to act on a proposal to allow the state to "create insurance opportunities for those that are uninsured today."

description_txt: stated on April 29, 2010 in his radio program:
quote_txt: Alaska's Prince William Sound "is pristine now."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2010 in press release:
quote_txt: "Klein did not hold a single town hall meeting (on health care) where the general public was invited to ask questions or present their views."

description_txt: stated on April 29, 2010 in an interview on CNN.:
quote_txt: "The governor switched his position once again on offshore oil drilling."

description_txt: stated on April 27, 2010 in a newspaper column:
quote_txt: Says Texas General Land Office “has earned the school children of Texas $451,932.89 on wind leases that haven't produced a watt of energy."

description_txt: stated on April 28, 2010 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: Members of Congress "have not reduced their salaries ... since the Great Depression," meaning they've gone "eight decades without a pay cut."

description_txt: stated on April 24, 2010 in a radio address:
quote_txt: Says the American public "overwhelmingly opposed" Democratic-steered health care plan.

description_txt: stated on April 29, 2010 in various comments over the past few months:
quote_txt: On whether to run for the U.S. Senate as an independent.

description_txt: stated on April 28, 2010 in a campaign memo.:
quote_txt: "By registration fewer than 20 percent of Florida voters are Independents."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2010 in a press release:
quote_txt: Says a Bureau of Labor Statistics report attributed a sharp increase in work-related fatalities to "increasing numbers of employees and drivers could not read or understand warning signs in English."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2010 in an email:
quote_txt: The more than $800,000 raised by the Alan Grayson campaign last quarter was "#1 among all 435 members of the U.S. House of Representatives."

description_txt: stated on April 21, 2010 in an interview on MSNBC's Daily Rundown:
quote_txt: "Congress can tell [the Supreme Court] which cases they ought to hear. We have that authority."

description_txt: stated on April 15, 2010 in an interview with The Texas Tribune and Newsweek:
quote_txt: "We've got a 1,000 National Guard troop request that's been in front of this president for over a year and no response."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2010 in an interview on MSNBC's Hardball:
quote_txt: The new Arizona immigration law "says that any police officer can stop anyone who appears to them to be reasonably suspicious of being an undocumented person."

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2010 in an interview on MSNBC's Hardball:
quote_txt: Under the new Arizona immigration law, police can't stop someone to check their immigration status unless they think they see something illegal.

description_txt: stated on April 26, 2010 in a statement on his campaign website:
quote_txt: "Currently we have some 40-45% of Americans who are not paying any taxes."

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2010 in a panel discussion on ABC This Week:
quote_txt: "What the Arizona law does is make a state crime out of something that already is... a federal crime."

description_txt: stated on April 21, 2010 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: GM has "repaid our government loan, in full, with interest, five years ahead of the original schedule."

description_txt: stated on April 22, 2010 in announcing his campaign for the U.S. House.:
quote_txt: Gov. Lawton Chiles said "if I were to become ... become speaker of the House it would be (his) worst nightmare."

description_txt: stated on April 22, 2010 in a statement.:

description_txt: stated on April 25, 2010 in an interview on "This Week.":
quote_txt: "Fifteen years ago, the assets of the six largest banks in this country totaled 17 percent of GDP ... The assets of the six largest banks in the United States today total 63 percent of GDP."

description_txt: stated on April 13, 2010 in a segment on the Fox News show The O'Reilly Factor:
